subject: Re: [junit] Is it possible to automatically run two complete sets of tests?
msgSnippet: ... Sure thing:  http://testng.org In a nutshell, you just put your test methods in groups as you implement them: @Test(groups = { fake }) public void
messageBody:
On 6/2/06, Pat Farrell <pfarrell@...> wrote:
>
>
> > TestNG's answer to this is test groups: put your test methods in
> various
> > groups, e.g. "fake" or "jdbc" and then run just that group.
>
> OK, probably a dumb question, what is a test group? Got a URL so I
> can get smarter? sample code, etc.


Sure thing: http://testng.org

In a nutshell, you just put your test methods in groups as you implement
them:

@Test(groups = {"fake"})
public void aTestWithAFakeConnection() {
...
}

@Test(groups = {"jdbc"})
public void aTestWithARealConnection() {
...
}

@Test(groups = {"jdbc", "fake"}
public void aTestThatWillRunInBothCases() {
..
}

And then, invoke TestNG with the group(s) you want: "fake" will invoke the
first and third method while running group "jdbc" will only run the second
and third method.

--
Cédric
